definition: Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
forced labor/corvée/obligatory task/military service/to use as servant/to enserf/servant (old)/war/campaign/battle

sentences.english: The event was prior to the battle of Huaihai.
sentences.chinese: 這件事件在淮海戰役之前。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役對解放戰爭的勝利至關重要。

sentences.english: The Huai-Hai Campaign was essential to the victory of the War of    Liberation.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役對解放戰爭的勝利至關重要。

sentences.english: Huai Hai Campaign was the last major combat between two Chinese political parties.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役是國共兩黨所率軍隊之間最大的戰役。

sentences.english: He represented that he had fought in the Huai Hai Campaign.
sentences.chinese: 他自稱他參加過淮海戰役。

sentences.english: The Huai Hai Campaign was long and very complex.
sentences.chinese: 淮海戰役長而且非常複雜。

sentences.english: When we prepared to join in the Huai-Hai Campaign, the general situation was excellent.
sentences.chinese: 迎接淮海戰役的時候，總的形勢很好。
